author: Phil Helsel
description: A Tennessee federal judge on Thursday ordered new trials for three former Memphis police officers who were convicted of felony counts in the beating death of Tyre Nichols after a 2023 traffic stop
title: 3 officers ordered to have new trials in death of Tyre Nichols

author: Gary Grumbach
description: U.S. Attorney Jeanine Pirro's office on Thursday charged a man accused of throwing a sandwich at a Customs and Border Protection agent in Washington D.C. earlier this month with misdemeanor assault, issuing the charge one day after failing to convince a grand jury to return a felony indictment against the alleged assailant.
title: Man who threw sandwich at federal officer in D.C. charged with misdemeanor assault

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: Catalina "Xochitl" Santiago, 28, has renewed her DACA status several times, which her attorneys point out requires "rigorous background checks."
title: Immigrant activist's detention highlights DACA recipients' growing deportation risks

author: Erika Edwards
description: An escalating conflict over an influential vaccine committee was one of the final straws that led to the firing of CDC Director Susan Monarez and the exodus of other highly regarded top officials.
title: CDC crisis triggered by upcoming vaccine meeting, leading to director’s firing and resignations

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: The 8-year-old killed in the tragic Annunciation Catholic School shooting Wednesday was identified by his father as Fletcher Merkel
title: 8-year-old killed in Minneapolis shooting remembered as a lover of family, friends and sports

description: Jesse Merkel, the father of 8-year-old Minneapolis shooting victim Fletcher Merkel, spoke out after the violent attack that killed his son. Merkel asked that his son be remembered for who he was, not the act of violence that ended his life.
title: 'Give your kids an extra hug and kiss': Father of 8-year-old victim speaks out

author: Andrew Greif
description: All-Pro linebacker Micah Parsons will become the NFL's highest-paid non-quarterback after being dealt from the Cowboys to the Packers in a blockbuster trade.
title: Cowboys deal star pass rusher Micah Parsons to Packers in stunning trade

description: The number of homeless Americans over the age of 65 is expected to more than double in the next five years. For many of them, it will be their first time being homeless. NBC News’ Stephanie Gosk traveled to Phoenix, AZ, where homeless seniors are fighting rising rents and hundred-degree days.
title: The Gray Wave: Rising Homelessness for American Seniors

description: Video captures the moments children inside Annunciation Church fled outside after a shooter opened fire. At least two children were killed and 18 were injured in the mass shooting in Minneapolis.
title: Video shows children fleeing from Annunciation Church after shooting

author: Suzanne Gamboa
description: he Justice Department can now hire attorneys without immigration law experience to help reduce case backlogs; critics cite concerns over inexperience and possible "political bias."
title: Trump eases rules for hiring temporary immigration judges

author: Mosheh Gains
description: The Air Force offered full military funeral honors to Ashli Babbitt, the rioter who was fatally shot by police as she stormed the U.S. Capitol.
title: Jan. 6 rioter Ashli Babbitt offered full military funeral, Air Force confirms

author: Sara G. Miller
description: Health officials are investigating a salmonella outbreak linked to eggs that has sickened 95 people across the United States, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said Thursday
title: Salmonella outbreak linked to eggs sickens 95 people, CDC says

description: During a press briefing, White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said that President Trump fired CDC Director Susan Monarez after she refused to resign. Leavitt added that Monarez "was not aligned" with the administration and a replacement would be announced soon.
title: White House confirms Trump fired CDC director after she refused to resign

description: Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey said “thoughts and prayers are not going to cut it” after the mass shooting at a Catholic school, calling for state and federal bans on assault weapons and high-capacity magazines.
title: Minneapolis mayor: 'We need a statewide and a federal ban on assault weapons'

author: Reuters
description: Britain, France and Germany launched a 30-day process to reimpose U.N. sanctions on Iran over its nuclear programme on Thursday, according to a letter sent by the three nations to the U.N.
title: Iran is facing a return of U.N. sanctions — what happens now?

author: Rob Wile
description: U.S. shoppers ordering smaller goods from abroad are being met with waves of cancellation notices ahead of a key trade rule change ordered by the Trump administration.
title: Shoppers see order cancellations as world shuts down U.S.-bound shipments

author: Tyler Kingkade
description: Tech products like Dialogues and Sway aim to improve civility and encourage healthy discourse on college campuses.
title: Agree to disagree: How chat platforms and AI could transform campus debates

author: David K. Li
description: A state-appointed North Carolina elections official resigned from his post on Thursday, officials said, after he was arrested and accused of spiking his granddaughters' ice cream with illicit narcotics
title: North Carolina election official arrested, accused of spiking granddaughters' ice cream with drugs

author: Doha Madani
description: Prosecutors filed charges against a mother in the alleged murder of her 4-year-old son after authorities said that "spiritual delusions" led her to throw the boy into a Ohio lake.
title: Ohio mother charged with aggravated murder in death of her 4-year-old son

author: Aria Bendix
description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
title: Doctors say RFK Jr.'s push for nutrition education in medicine is a good idea — in theory

author: Rebecca Shabad
description: Former MLB All-Star Mark Teixeira, who played for the New York Yankees, announced Thursday that he's running for a House seat in Texas
title: Former Major League Baseball player Mark Teixeira announces Texas congressional bid

author: Rebecca Cohen
description: Influencer Emilie Kiser, whose 3-year-old son died in May after drowning in the family's backyard pool, spoke out for the first time in an Instagram statement on Thursday, saying she knows there was more she could have done to protect him.
title: Emilie Kiser speaks out for first time on son's death: 'I should have done more to protect him'

author: Nigel Chiwaya
description: The NBC News Home Buyer Index shows competition for homes and available listings have dried up as the market waits for interest rate cuts.
title: The housing market's sleepy summer, in 3 charts

author: Dareh Gregorian
description: Members of the Washington, D.C. City Council are pushing back against Mayor Muriel Bowser's remarks that Donald Trump's surge of federal law enforcement personnel into the city has helped lower crime.
title: D.C. Democrats rebuke Mayor Muriel Bowser's comments that Trump's surge reduced crime

author: Ryan J. Reilly
description: Democrats are investigating Attorney General Pam Bondi's and FBI Director Kash Patel's moves to gut public corruption offices.
title: Democrats probe Trump administration's retreat from public corruption cases

author: Jay Ganglani
description: The Spicomellus, the world’s oldest ankylosaur, had spikes protruding from its neck, a weapon on its tail and extravagant armor, it has been discovered.
title: Spikes, a tail weapon and a shield: Was this the world's weirdest dinosaur?

author: Akayla Gardner
description: The White House said it has fired a member of the Surface Transportation Board, a move that comes as the independent federal regulatory agency is considering the proposed merger of Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern railroad companies.
title: White House moves to fire transportation regulator, who calls the action 'legally invalid'

author: Steve Kopack
description: Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook sued President Donald Trump on Thursday, the beginning of a landmark legal battle over what she calls Trump's "unprecedented and illegal" efforts to remove her from the central bank and the committee that makes decisions about the nation's interest rates
title: Fed governor Lisa Cook sues Trump over 'unprecedented and illegal' effort to fire her

author: Molly Hunter
description: International news agency Reuters says that it stopped sharing the locations of its teams in the Gaza Strip with the Israeli military after “so many journalists were killed in IDF strikes.”
title: Reuters stopped sharing Gaza locations with Israel after many journalists killed in IDF strikes

author: Kaitlin Sullivan
description: Dr. Rakesh Parekh was in his mid-40s when he first noticed something was wrong: During his workouts, his left arm was weaker and struggled to keep up.
title: A tailormade drug slowed a man's ALS. Is it the future of treatment?

description: According to the ALS Association, most patients of the disease die within five years of diagnosis. Reporting for TODAY, NBC’s Anne Thompson shares a look at a groundbreaking therapy called an ASO that’s giving new hope for families.
title: Treatment for ALS Gives New Hope to Patients and Families

author: Corky Siemaszko
description: They led the charge to sound the alarm on and rid Miss Hall’s School of a teacher who they allege preyed on them.
title: Miss Hall’s School abuse survivors working to protect teens from predator teachers

description: Vincent Francoual, the father of an 11-year-old girl who survived the deadly shooting at Annunciation school in Minneapolis, shares how his daughter is coping a day after the shooting, saying that the family is taking her recovery one hour at a time. Francoual said when the family got home after the shooting, he could “see the fear” in his daughter.
title: Father says he could ‘see the fear’ in his daughter after Minneapolis school shooting

description: The head of the Centers for Disease Control, Dr. Susan Monarez, is refusing to leave after the White House tried to fire her amid clashes over vaccine policies but a White House spokesperson says because Monarez refused to resign, the White House has terminated her from her position. The move prompted four other high-ranking CDC leaders to step down from their posts. NBC’s Peter Alexander reports for TODAY.
title: WH Fires CDC Director Amid Clashes Over Vaccine Policies

author: Christian Orozco
description: A shooting at a Minneapolis Catholic school.
title: Search for answers after Minnesota shooting and CDC director fired: Morning Rundown

description: Minneapolis Police Chief Brian O'Hara joins TODAY to share an update on the investigation of the shooting at Annunciation Church Wednesday, if they are close to determining a motive for the shooter and the conditions of those who were injured.
title: Minneapolis Police Chief Shares Update on Church Shooting

description: Watch live coverage as White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt holds a press briefing.
title: White House holds press briefing

author: Curtis Bunn
description: Cook weathered racist attacks as a child and became a pioneer as a Black woman economist. Her latest fight is to keep her position on the Board of Governors at the Federal Reserve.
title: Lisa Cook's path to Fed governor prepared her for a fight in the spotlight

author: Kayla Steinberg
description: British artist Jess Chappell is cutting off sales to the United States as new trade policies take effect this week.
title: Rocky waters ahead for British artist stopping sales to customers across the pond

author: Andrew Greif
description: A lack of coaching experience didn't stop Deion Sanders from taking college football by storm. Has that model paved the way for other, non-traditional hires?
title: The Deion Sanders Effect: Why colleges are hiring former NFL stars as coaches

description: At least 12 people were killed and dozens more injured after an overnight Russian drone attack on Ukraine’s capital Kyiv. The strike marks the first major Russian attack on Kyiv in weeks as U.S.-led peace talks to end the war struggle to gain traction.
title: At least 12 killed in Russian drone strike on Kyiv

author: Daryna Mayer
description: Russia unleashed a massive overnight attack on the Ukrainian capital that killed at least 10 people and injured 38, local officials said early Thursday.
title: Massive Russian attack on Ukraine's capital kills at least 10 as Trump's peace push stalls

description: The Minneapolis community gathered at the Academy of Holy Angels for a prayer service honoring the Annunciation Catholic School victims. NBC News’ Maggie Vespa spoke with some of the attendees, who expressed their respect and support for the victims.
title: Minneapolis community honors Annunciation Catholic School victims at prayer service

author: Jennifer Jett
description: HONG KONG — North Korean leader Kim Jong Un will make a rare overseas visit next week to attend a military parade in the Chinese capital, Chinese state media reported Thursday
title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un to attend military parade in Beijing next week

description: After several journalists were killed in an Israeli strike on Gaza's Nasser hospital, news organizations including Reuters are coming out to say that Israel was aware that reporters were operating from the location of the strike. Fellow journalists working in Gaza emphasize that the IDF was aware of their locations before the two back-to-back strikes on one of the few hospitals still operating there.
title: Questions remain after IDF strike kills journalists in Gaza

description: Twenty years after Hurricane Katrina devastated New Orleans, 60 percent of the residents of the hardest hit Lower Ninth Ward haven't returned. A retired army general who was in charge of the federal relief efforts in the neighborhood remembers the thousands of devastated people impacted by the hurricane. NBC News' Priscilla Thompson visits the Lower Ninth Ward and speaks with Russel Honoré about his experience in the aftermath of the deadly disaster.
title: Revisiting New Orleans neighborhood devastated by Katrina 20 years later

author: Ryan Chandler
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. joined Texas Gov. Greg Abbott as he signed into law a trio of MAHA-inspired bills.
title: Texas enacts MAHA bills as RFK Jr. joins Gov. Abbott for signing ceremony

author: Tim Stelloh
description: A nonverbal New Orleans boy who disappeared earlier this month was found dead Tuesday and appears to have died in part from an alligator attack, officials said
title: Missing New Orleans boy died from blunt force trauma from alligator, authorities say
